questions.question: What is Optional Practical Training (OPT)?
questions.answer: Optional Practical Training (OPT) is designed for F-1 students to gain practical work experience in their major field of study for a total of up to 12 months, during their studies or immediately following their degree completion. Students are eligible for OPT once per each higher educational level.

types: STEM OPT Extension (additional 24 months for STEM degrees)
eligibility_requirements: Must have been enrolled full-time in F-1 student status for at least one academic year (two consecutive terms)
Must not have exceed 364 days of full-time CPT in current program
Do not need a job offer to apply

questions.question: What is Pre-Completion OPT?
questions.answer: Pre-Completion OPT is an off-campus work authorization that can only be used during your studies. You can apply as early as 90 days before you reach the one academic year requirement. It can be a great option for students who have found a job they want to work over summer vacation but are not eligible for CPT authorization.

work_hours.during_semester: Must work less than 20 hours per week (part-time)
work_hours.during_breaks: Can work more than 20 hours (full-time) during school breaks (Summer or Winter Intersession)

metadata.time_deduction: Students who use part-time Pre-Completion OPT deduct days at half the rate. For example, if you work for 5 months on part-time Pre-Completion OPT, only 2.5 months are deducted from the total 12 months.

questions.question: What is Post-Completion OPT?
questions.answer: Post-Completion OPT is the off-campus work benefit that can only be used after your studies (once you have met the requirements for your degree).

timing.earliest_start: Can start work as early as the day after degree completion (assuming filed graduation application in a timely manner)
timing.latest_start: Can start work as late as 60 days after degree completion (latest OPT start day)

requirements: Must have full-time employment (over 20 hours per week)
Students are expected to work during the OPT period
Must report employment on SEVP Portal
Limited to an aggregate maximum of 90 days of unemployment

questions.question: What is STEM OPT Extension?
questions.answer: STEM OPT is an additional 24 months of work authorization for students with a STEM qualifying degree. Only students who are on a period of approved Post-Completion OPT, with a STEM qualify degree, may apply for this extension.

requirements: Employer must be enrolled in the E-Verify system
Position must be paid and full-time (over 20 hours per week)
All employment must be in your STEM major field of study

questions.question: Where can I get additional help with OPT questions?
questions.answer: Do you have more questions about the OPT application process, requested dates, and travel on OPT? Stop by our bi-weekly OPT drop-in advising hour to speak with an ISSS advisor.

format.primary: Most sessions will be held via zoom

questions.question: What is your Program End Date and where can you find it?
questions.answer: Your Program End is the date when you complete your program requirements (usually the date of your last class or completion of your last assignment or exam).

metadata.location: Typically reflected on the first page of your I-20 Form
exceptions: Some students may complete their program earlier
Some students may require a program extension to complete their program later than the date listed

questions.question: What is a Grace Period and why is it important?
questions.answer: After you complete your program, you have 60 days to consider your options for staying in the U.S. also known as your 60 Day Grace Period.

travel.international: Cannot re-enter in F-1 status if you leave the U.S.

questions.question: When is the OPT application window?
questions.answer: A student's 5-month application period starts from 90 days before their program completion and ends 60 days after their program completion date in which USCIS must receive your OPT application.

metadata.processing_time: Typically takes 3-4 months for USCIS to process an OPT application
metadata.recommendation: Apply early due to processing time

questions.question: When should you submit your OPT application after receiving your OPT I-20 Form?
questions.answer: Your OPT I-20 Form is valid for 30 days from the date the ISSS office recommended you for OPT.

important_notes.deadline: The OPT application must be submitted to USCIS within 30 days of this date
important_notes.consequences: Applications submitted with an OPT I-20 Form 30 days after initial issuance will result in an application denial
important_notes.solution: If exceeding 30 days, submit another OPT request via MyISSS portal to receive a new OPT I-20 Form

questions.question: When can you start working on OPT?
questions.answer: A student who finishes all program requirements can choose an OPT start date from one day after their program completion to 60 days after that date.

important_requirements: Cannot start working before the OPT start date listed on the EAD card
Must physically have possession of your EAD card to start working
metadata.processing_recommendation: Please try to give USCIS 90 days of processing before your requested OPT start date

questions.question: When does your work authorization end on OPT?
questions.answer: The OPT end date will be 12 months after the student's chosen OPT start date.

limitations.post_completion: The latest end date for Post-Completion OPT will never be beyond 14-months after program completion

pre_completion_impact.part_time: Students who use part-time Pre-Completion OPT deduct from Post-Completion OPT days at half the rate
pre_completion_impact.full_time: Students who use full-time Pre-Completion OPT deduct at the full rate

questions.question: Can students remain in the U.S. after finishing their period of OPT?
questions.answer: Students who complete their OPT period have a 60 Day Grace Period after their OPT has ended.

grace_period_details.restrictions: Cannot work during this grace period
grace_period_details.early_termination: If OPT ends early, no 60 Day Grace Period is afforded and should depart the U.S. soon after

questions.question: Do you qualify for the 2-year STEM OPT Extension?
questions.answer: Students who are on a period of approved Post-Completion OPT and have a STEM-qualifying degree can apply for the 24-month STEM OPT extension.

questions.question: When should students apply for the STEM OPT Extension?
questions.answer: Students should apply 90 days before their Post-Completion OPT expires.

important_notes.deadline: Once the Post-Completion OPT expires, students are no longer eligible to apply

questions.question: Can students travel during OPT?
questions.answer: It is possible to travel while applying for or on OPT, but students should have all the information and documents they need before departing the U.S.

important_notes.preparation: It can be much harder to prepare for reentry from outside of the U.S. and while traveling
important_notes.passport_requirement: Your passport should always be valid for 6 months into the future

questions.question: Should students travel while their OPT application is pending?
questions.answer: Travel before your OPT is approved can be complicated.

scenarios.before_graduation: Until you complete your program of study, you will continue to travel as an enrolled student
scenarios.after_graduation: Once you have graduated, the documents that you need will vary depending on the status of your OPT application

approval_during_travel.requirement: If your OPT application was pending when you left the U.S. but is approved before you have returned, you will need to have your EAD card with you to reenter the U.S.
approval_during_travel.risk: This may require international mailing adding additional risk and complications

questions.question: What to consider before international travel after graduation?
questions.answer: After students complete their program, you have 60 days to consider your options for staying in the U.S. also known as your 60 Day Grace Period.

travel_restrictions.domestic: Can travel within the U.S. during the 60-day grace period

international.without_opt: Cannot re-enter in F-1 status if you leave the U.S. without applying for OPT
international.with_pending_opt: Students can re-enter in F-1 status with a pending OPT application

metadata.recommendations: Students applying for OPT after their Program Completion and on their 60 Day Grace Period should submit their OPT application to USCIS before departing the U.S.

questions.question: Can students work abroad while on OPT?
questions.answer: Students on OPT or STEM OPT should remain primarily in the U.S. for their employment.

time_restrictions.status_loss: Remaining outside of the U.S. for more than 5 months can result in the loss of your F-1 status
time_restrictions.unemployment: Students on OPT and STEM OPT can be seen as gaining days of unemployment if they are outside of the U.S. for extended periods of time
time_restrictions.consultation_required: Students on OPT and STEM OPT taking trips abroad for more than 1 month should consult their ISSS advisor

questions.question: What should I know about the SEVP portal?
questions.answer: All students on Post-Completion OPT are required to report their personal information and employment information on the SEVP Portal within 10 days of the change.

metadata.system_integration: The SEVP portal is connected to SEVIS (Student and Exchange Visitor Information System) and data is shared between the two systems

questions.question: How will I get access to the SEVP portal?
questions.answer: Students approved for OPT will be contacted on their OPT start date to create their SEVP portal account.

troubleshooting.if_not_received: Check spam or junk mail folder

questions.question: How can I set up my SEVP portal account?
questions.answer: Create your account using the temporary password and unique registration link and begin reporting your information.

setup_restrictions.link_usage: Can only use the link once
setup_restrictions.validity: Link valid for 14 days from sending
setup_restrictions.if_expired: Contact isss@usfca.edu to have the notice sent again

pre_completion_note.access: Students approved for Pre-Completion OPT do not get access to the SEVP portal
pre_completion_note.address_changes: Should report changes to their address on MyISSS

questions.question: What are the reporting requirements on OPT?
questions.answer: Students are required to report changes to your address and employment information to the SEVP portal within 10 days of the change while on Post-Completion OPT.

questions.question: Why is it important to report employment on OPT?
questions.answer: You need to self-report your employment on the SEVP portal or you will be considered unemployed on OPT.

metadata.unemployment_impact: Every day that a student has reported qualifying employment on the SEVP portal will not count towards the 90-day unemployment limit

questions.question: What information is needed to report?
questions.answer: When reporting your employment on the SEVP portal, you will need to list your work address and document how your employment is related to your major field of study.

work_location.remote: Remote address as work location if working remotely

employment_details: Number of hours you are working per week
How your job duties relate to your major field of study

stem_opt_note.difference: OPT reporting requirements differ to STEM OPT reporting requirements
stem_opt_note.stem_reporting: Need to report job changes to MyISSS

questions.question: How do I access and report employment on the SEVP Portal?
questions.answer: You can access the SEVP Portal through the official website and follow the user guide for detailed instructions on reporting employment.

questions.question: If you change your visa status while on OPT, what should you do next?
questions.answer: If you have been approved and have changed to another immigration status during your OPT period, report this Change of Status to ISSS.

reporting_process.method: Submit a Visa Category Update request via MyISSS
reporting_process.purpose: To check that your F-1 record is ended correctly

important_notes.status_maintenance: In most cases, you won't be able to maintain your OPT and F-1 status when you are in another status in the U.S.
important_notes.consultation: Speak with your immigration attorney and ISSS if changing immigration status

questions.question: What is the Cap Gap Extension?
questions.answer: Students who have a pending or approved cap-subject H-1B petition and requested a Change of Status to H-1B before their F-1 status ends are eligible for a Cap Gap extension.

extension_details.purpose: Extend F-1 status and, in some cases, work authorization before H-1B goes into effect
extension_details.request_process: Can request a Cap Gap I-20 via MyISSS

questions.question: What is the OPT application process?
questions.answer: The process of applying for Optional Practical Training (OPT) employment authorization is very detailed. It is important to pay close attention to this course and follow the steps outlined accurately.

steps: Complete the OPT course via Canvas within 1 year of when you will apply for OPT
Prepare your application materials in a digital format
Submit the OPT I-20 request through MyISSS
Retrieve your OPT I-20 Form, print, physically sign, and date it in black ink
Create a USCIS account and complete your OPT application (Form I-765) online
Pay the filing fee and submit your application to USCIS

questions.question: What Application Materials do you need to apply for OPT?
questions.answer: The application requires several documents for both the OPT I-20 Form request and the I-765 OPT application.

i20_request_documents: Screenshot Proof of Completion of OPT Canvas Course

i765_documents.item: Previous CPT and OPT I-20 Forms
i765_documents.details: If applicable, scan copies of all pages with CPT and OPT authorization

questions.question: How do you request your OPT I-20 Form via MyISSS?
questions.answer: The process involves submitting a request through MyISSS and getting approval from your academic advisor.

metadata.important_deadlines: Submit I-765 OPT application to USCIS within 30 days of the I-20 issuance date

questions.question: How do you submit your OPT application to USCIS?
questions.answer: The process involves creating a USCIS Online Account and submitting the I-765 application online.

premium_processing.description: Service that expedites processing within 30 business days
requirements: Pay additional filing fee of $1,685.00 USD

questions.question: How can you track the status of your application?
questions.answer: USCIS Average Processing Time is 3-4 months from submitting Form I-765.

tracking_methods: Check case status and case history tabs in USCIS online account
View electronic copies of notices in Documents tab

questions.question: What is an Employment Authorization Document (EAD) card?
questions.answer: The EAD card is your proof of work authorization in the United States and is issued after OPT application approval by USCIS.

delivery_info.method: Mailed to physical address on I-765 application
delivery_info.tracking: USPS tracking number available in case status tab
delivery_info.timeline: Typically delivered within a week of mailing

ssn_info.new_applicants: Will receive SSN card separately, typically 7 business days after EAD card
ssn_info.existing_ssn: Do not need to apply again with I-765 OPT application
ssn_info.purpose: Required by employer for wage and tax purposes

questions.question: How do you renew your F-1 student visa during OPT?
questions.answer: Even during OPT or STEM OPT, your immigration status in the U.S. is still F-1 Student. If your F-1 student visa stamp will expire before you plan to return to the U.S., you need to renew it.

renewal_process.description: The visa renewal application is much like the initial visa application and in almost all cases will require you to apply in person and sit for an interview.
additional_documents: OPT I-20 with valid travel signature endorsement signed in the past six months as found on the second page
Proof of Employment or search of employment (Letter from employer)

questions.question: What work can students engage in during OPT?
questions.answer: Students can only engage in employment related to their major field of study on OPT.

employment_criteria.field: Must be in major field of study

field_verification.method: Students should show direct connection of job duties to course curriculum
field_verification.consultation: If unsure, ask academic department for opinion
field_verification.responsibility: Ultimately up to the student to demonstrate this connection

questions.question: What are the location requirements for employment?
questions.answer: Students working on OPT can work in-person, in a hybrid format or remotely from within the US.

work_flexibility.geographic: Can work anywhere in the United States
work_flexibility.employer_count: Can work with multiple employers at one time
work_flexibility.changes: Can change employers as many times as they wish

remote_work.restriction: Not possible to work fully remotely from outside of the US
remote_work.requirement: Must report a US address as the site of employment
remote_work.travel: Temporary travel abroad is allowed, but a physical US address is still required

questions.question: What is considered employment?
questions.answer: Students on OPT are expected to be employed during their approved OPT period.

requirements.field: Position must be related to major field of study

questions.question: Is there a limit on the number of days I can be unemployed?
questions.answer: Unemployment limits vary by OPT type

post_completion.consequence: Exceeding 90 days results in F-1 status violation

questions.question: When do I start accruing unemployment days?
questions.answer: You will start accruing unemployment days on your approved OPT start date if you do not report qualifying employment on the SEVP portal.

important_notes.warning: Students who do not receive their EAD card after their OPT start date could also accrue unemployment days
important_notes.severe_consequence: SEVP can terminate your SEVIS record if you have not reported an employer or have exceeded the maximum days of unemployment

questions.question: What happens if you exceed the unemployment limit?
questions.answer: Students who exceed 90 days of unemployment will be considered in violation of their OPT and F-1 status.

student_responsibilities: Report employment on the SEVP portal
Ensure not exceeding 90 days of unemployment

questions.question: What are your options before you exceed the unemployment limit and violate your visa status?
questions.answer: There are several actions you can take before exceeding 90 days of unemployment
